properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 8 at 4:15AM PST until January 8 at 1:53PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...Flood Warnings continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County
Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston
Counties
Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County

No hydrologically significant precipitation in the forecast for the
next two days. Another front will arrive on Friday but snow levels
will be low, below 2000 feet, keeping the precipitation in the
form of snow in the mountains limiting runoff into the rivers.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda
* Until this afternoon.
* At  3:45 AM Wednesday the stage was 211.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 211.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring.
* Forecast...The river crested at 212.9 feet at 5 PM Tuesday and will
continue to fall to below flood stage this morning.
* Impact...At 211.5 feet, the Skookumchuck River in Thurston County
will flood a few roads and low pasture lands near Bucoda.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until this afternoon
